posts.body:
>>1f49e1d8-5faa-4a25-b5d6-879304551b72
>due to scripts that can deanonymize your exit node
They work by pinging a site with your clear IP. It's not supposed to happen, but javascript is so complicated that it's hard for web browser writers to make sure it doesn't.
>Zeronet has no scripts since its decentralized.
Dynamic ZeroNet zites work purely by using scripts. If the FBI gets ahold of Acid's private keys they can run javascript exploits just like they did with Playpen. Except in this case it's impossible to use the zite while having scripts disabled.

>>8d7ee359-db75-4155-831a-f57784a251e6
>In that case it's most likely that the admin didn't remove 08chan from the config.js file
If it's removed, will the old posts still show up?
>>8d7ee359-db75-4155-831a-f57784a251e6
>>1bf62288-38f3-4e31-a373-54232e5bcfb7
Do any of you know how can I switch programmatically to a ZeroID cert for this zite once it has already been generated and installed? Assume I can edit any file on the computer.
Here's how my script is going if anyone's interested. https://pastebin.com/KHr0SSAZ

>>6b79426a-2405-4dff-9c30-d0eff04b4be4
>Tor is build in a way that allows glows to own every single node, including the hidden service and still not know shit about you or what you're doing.
That's not true. If they own every node, they own you.

>>46682699-3d9d-493f-af98-b10325c655af
Generates a new random looking ZeroID.

>>be3df6a0-0b41-449d-8db3-1a4af80faf78
Every time it's run. I guess it would be possible to integrate it with the board's software, but I'm not planning on doing that.

>>d071a429-7686-4a19-90ff-3bd888a40be7
In any case it's only meant to be a patchwork solution. Anything that needs to be installed besides ZeroNet won't be used by anyone besides maybe two or three people, and that kinda defeats the point.
